text: Emmit King (March 24, 1959 â€“ November 28, 2021) was an American track and field sprinter. He won the first bronze medal at the 1983 World Championships. He competed at the 1984 and 1988 Olympics. King was shot and killed on November 28, 2021, in Bessemer, Alabama at the age of 62. ==References== Category:1959 births Category:2021 deaths Category:American sprinters Category:Olympians for the United States Category:Sportspeople from Alabama Category:People from Bessemer, Alabama Category:Murders by firearm in the United States
title: Emmit King
